result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marciano Lopez-Lopez

records.addlTxt: from Atty. Andrusius requesting an adjournment of the pretrial conference, filed.  rmm
Branch 01 not in session this on November 14, 2022. Court date change to November 18, 2022. All parties notified of this change of date.

Adjustment Number: 22A 095866,
Payable Number: 1037177,
Receipt Number: 22RP040172,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marciano Lopez-Lopez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Marciano Lopez-Lopez.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
